app.name: GitButler
app.description: A Git client for productive developers

welcome.should_be_git_repo: Should be a valid git repository
welcome.clone_repo_url: Clone a repo using a URL

branches.title: Branches
branches.independent_description: Create an independent branch in a new stack.
branches.dependent_description: Create a branch dependent on the current branch.
branches.will_be_applied: The new branch will be applied in parallel with other stacks in the workspace.
branches.adjust_placement: Adjust branch placement and preferences in
branches.create_new_branch: Create a new branch or fetch from your remote.
branches.rename_warning: Renaming a branch that has already been pushed will create a new branch at the remote. The old one will remain untouched but will be disassociated from this branch.
branches.delete_branch_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this branch?
branches.delete_branch_with_name: Are you sure you want to delete {branchName}?
branches.empty_branch_instructions: Create or drag & drop commits here.
branches.new_branch_description: Commit your changes here. You can stack additional branches or apply them independently. You can also drag and drop files to start a new commit.
branches.no_commits_yet: There are no commits yet on this branch.

commits.title: Commits
commits.drop_files: Drop files to assign or commit directly
commits.drop_files_to_start: Drop files to start a branch

settings.title: Settings
settings.auto_fill_pr: Auto-fill PR/MR description from first commit
settings.auto_fill_pr_description: When creating a pull request or merge request for a branch with just one commit, automatically use that commit's message as the PR/MR title and description.
settings.run_git_hook_description: Enabling this will run git pre-push, pre and post commit, and commit-msg hooks you have configured in your repository.
settings.free_tier_description: By default, everything in the GitButler client is free to use. You can opt in to crediting us as the committer in your virtual branch commits to help spread the word.
settings.sign_commits_description: Use GPG or SSH to sign your commits so they can be verified as authentic. GitButler will sign commits as per your git configuration, but evaluates gitbutler.signCommits with priority.
settings.allow_force_pushing_description: Force pushing allows GitButler to override branches even if they were pushed to remote. GitButler will never force push to the target branch.
settings.force_push_protection_description: Protect remote commits during force pushes. This will use Git's safer force push flags to avoid overwriting remote commit history.
settings.ignore_host_certificate_checks_descripti: Enabling this will ignore host certificate checks when authenticating with ssh.
settings.gerrit_configuration_description: Enable or disable Gerrit mode for this project.
settings.forge_not_detected: We couldn't detect which Forge you're using.
settings.forge_not_detected_description: To enable Forge integration, please select your Forge from the dropdown below.
settings.forge_not_supported: Currently, only GitHub and GitLab support pull request creation.
settings.forge_cannot_override: At the moment, it's not possible to manually override the detected forge type.
settings.add_github_account_general_settings: Add a GitHub account in General Settings to enable GitHub integration
settings.remove_project_description: Removing projects only clears configuration â€” your code stays safe.
settings.default_file_list_mode_description: Set the default file list view (can be changed per location).
settings.font_family_description: Sets the font for the diff view. The first font name is the default, others are fallbacks.
settings.tab_size_description: Number of spaces per tab in the diff view.
settings.soft_wrap_description: Soft wrap long lines in the diff view to fit within the viewport.
settings.lines_contrast_description: The contrast for added, deleted, and context lines in diffs.
settings.color_blind_friendly_description: Use blue and orange colors instead of green and red for better accessibility with color vision deficiency.
settings.display_word_diffs_inline_description: Instead of separate lines for removals and additions, this feature shows a single line with both added and removed words highlighted.
settings.scrollbar_on_scroll_description: Only show the scrollbar when you are scrolling.
settings.scrollbar_on_hover_description: Show the scrollbar only when you hover over the scrollable area.
settings.stage_all_files_description: Stage all files assigned to the stack on commit. If no files are staged, all unassigned files will be staged.
settings.stage_selected_files_description: Stage the selected assigned files to the stack on commit. If no files are selected, stage all files. If there are no assigned files, stage all selected unassigned files. And if no files are selected, stage all unassigned files.
settings.dont_stage_files_automatically_descripti: Do not stage any files automatically. You're more of a DIY developer in that way.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.update_branch_description: Update your branch to stay current
workspace.rebase_upstream_description: Place local-only changes on top, then the upstream changes. Similar to git pull --rebase.

rules.title: Rules
rules.let_rules_sort: Let rules automatically sort your changes.
rules.finish_editing: Please finish editing the current rule first
rules.cannot_edit_non_assignment: Cannot edit rules that are not branch assignments
rules.select_branch: Please select a branch to assign the rule

forge.github_remote: It looks like you have a {forge} remote!
forge.can_manage: GitButler can display, create and manage {unit} for you directly in the app.

snapshots.title: Snapshots
snapshots.snapshot_helper: Describe what you're saving for easy reference later
snapshots.empty_state_description: Gitbutler saves your work, including file changes, so your progress is always secure. Adjust snapshot settings in project settings.
snapshots.create_snapshot_tooltip: Create a manual snapshot of your current state

auth.login_description: Log in to access smart automation features, including intelligent branch creation and commit message generation.

ai.ai_support_description: GitButler supports the use of OpenAI and Anthropic to provide commit message and branch name generation. This works either through GitButler's API or in a bring your own key configuration and can be configured in the main preferences screen.
ai.credentials_secure: ðŸ”’ Credentials are persisted locally in your OS Keychain / Credential Manager.
ai.ai_providers_description: GitButler supports multiple AI providers: OpenAI and Anthropic (via API or your own key), plus local models through Ollama and LM Studio.
ai.enable_branch_commit_generation: Enable branch and commit message generation
ai.enable_branch_commit_generation_descript: If enabled, diffs will be sent to OpenAI or Anthropic's servers when pressing the "Generate message" and "Generate branch name" button.
ai.enable_experimental_ai_description: If enabled, you will be able to access the AI features currently in development. This also requires you to use OpenAI through GitButler in order for the features to work.
ai.custom_prompts_description: You can apply your own custom prompts to the project. By default, the project uses GitButler prompts, but you can create your own prompts in the general settings.
ai.remote_configuration_description: Lets you choose where to push code and set the target branch for contributions. The target branch is usually the "production" branch like 'origin/master' or 'upstream/main.' This section helps ensure your code goes to the correct remote and branch for integration.
ai.active_branches_in_workspace: You have {count} {singular} in your workspace. Please clear the workspace before switching the base branch.

codegen.claude_code_path_placeholder: Path to the Claude Code executable
codegen.claude_error_non_zero_code: Claude exited with a non 0 code
codegen.connect_claude_code_to_continue: Connect Claude Code to keep going with this session.
codegen.installing_mcp_servers: For installing additional MCP servers, check the
codegen.select_mcp_servers: Select the MCP Servers for this session. For installing additional MCP servers, check the
codegen.if_you_havent_installed: If you haven't installed Claude Code, check our
codegen.click_button_check_available: Click the button below to check if Claude Code is now available.
codegen.permission_modes_disable: Permission modes disable when all permissions are allowed
codegen.clear_context_confirmation: Are you sure you want to clear the context and delete all rules associated with this Claude session? This action cannot be undone.
codegen.disable_codegen_description: Hides the codegen button in the branch headers.
